channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After the CDC shooting, federal workers pressure RFK Jr. for more protections
item.description: More than 750 current and former HHS employees signed a letter to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. demanding he stop spreading inaccurate infor...

item.title: Some Florida farmers reduce crops as deportation fears drive workers away
item.description: U.S. farmers are feeling the impact of Trump's immigration crackdown. In some communities, immigration raids have slowed farm operations. NPR reports ...

item.title: How Attorney General Pam Bondi has reshaped the Justice Department to suit Trump
item.description: The New Yorker 's Ruth Marcus says Bondi has presided over the DOJ's most convulsive transition of power since Watergate, aggressively reversing polic...

item.title: Greetings from the Dubai airport, where a long layover can also be a destination
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Trump's control of D.C. police is limited. Its National Guard is a different story
item.description: President Trump needs Congress' permission to use D.C.'s police for over 30 days, but there are no such limits on its National Guard. Experts spoke to...

item.title: Hurricane Erin threatens the East Coast with flooding, violent winds and rip currents
item.description: Hurricane Erin is hovering over the Atlantic Ocean as a Category 2 storm, alarming parts of the East Coast as weather conditions worsen for communitie...

item.title: Tillis on Trump's D.C. crime crackdown: "What we are doing now is micromanaging local governments"
item.description: North Carolina Sen. Thom Tillis says Washington, D.C., does have a crime problem as the Trump administration deploys troops to the area, but tells CBS...

item.title: First domino in national redistricting fight likely to fall with Texas GOP poised for vote on maps
item.description: Texas’ Republican-led legislature is expected to approve new congressional maps that add five new House seats that the GOP could win.

item.title: Israel calls up 60,000 reservists ahead of planned Gaza City offensive
item.description: Troops are already operating in some areas ahead of the planned operation, which the ICRC says will worsen "an already catastrophic situation".

item.title: Unidentified flying object crashes and explodes in Poland
item.description: Local police said they received reports of the crash around 2 a.m. and found burned metal and plastic debris at the scene.

item.title: 8/20: CBS Morning News
item.description: White House says Putin agreed to meet with Volodymyr Zelenskyy; Employers turn to old school hiring tactics to rule out AI applicants.

item.title: Aerial footage shows final leg of Swedish church's move to new home
item.description: It took two days to move the church in Sweden's Kiruna, which was at risk at risk from ground subsidence.

item.title: South Korea tells tourists on holiday island Jeju to behave
item.description: The island has issued visitor guidelines for the first time as it sees an increasing number of tourists.

item.title: Man held after four bodies found in River Seine
item.description: A passer-by led French police to the grim discovery at the foot of a bridge south-east of Paris.

item.title: Kremlin plays down Zelensky talks as Trump warns Putin may not want to make deal
item.description: The US president conceded the war in Ukraine was "tough to solve" after several days of high-level talks.

item.title: Hurricane Erin could bring "life-threatening" surf, rip currents to East Coast
item.description: Meteorologists are closely tracking the projected path and forecast of Hurricane Erin, which is the first hurricane to develop over the Atlantic this ...

item.title: Even at the grocery store, Texas troopers don’t let Democrats out of sight after walkout
Immigrants seeking lawful work and citizenship are now subject to ‘anti-Americanism’ screening
